cont.entity_a: 4.2MP resolution is adequate with interpolation for larger images.
cont.entity_b: Kodak KAF8300CE CCD imager chip used for high performance.

cont.entity_a: Superior build quality compared to Canon Rebel series. Pro body with weather sealing and built-in hand grip.
cont.entity_b: Rubber-coated aluminum chassis feels better than Rebel or Nikon. Solid build and feels great in hand.

cont.entity_a: Pro autofocus with 45 points are standout features.
cont.entity_b: Finicky focus and lighting issues in automatic mode. Focusing issues persist.

cont.entity_a: Good as a backup camera due to ruggedness and speed.
cont.entity_b: Great for novice and pro users with many features and excellent image quality.

cont.entity_a: EF-S lenses are incompatible with the 1D.
Low resolution but great for general and close-up photography.
cont.entity_b: Excellent picture quality and easy to learn. Sharp images with minor color accuracy complaints.
Film card door issue resolved with velcro and superglue. Lenses have focusing issues, requiring repairs. Viewfinder is dim, and focusing can be tricky with included lenses.

cont.entity_a: Old technology, but 1600 ISO photos are usable.
Fast burst rate, but a new $600 DSLR surpasses it in other ways.
cont.entity_b: Focal plane dust removal system is unmatched by Canon and Nikon.

cont.entity_a: Not worth more than $500 unless for collection purposes.

cont.entity_b: Intuitive and easy to use with smooth controls. Menus are easy to navigate with well-laid-out buttons.
Powerful flash for its size with nice weight and balance.
